page.title: 02Satterthwaite Village
page.content:
{ Satterthwaite}village has a shop, a pub, some holiday cottages, a church, a parish room and some houses.
{ The church}was built in 1850 and its average attendance now is about 18. The most popular service each year is the Harvest Festival. There are 2 services each week, one is on a Friday and the other is on a Sunday. The church organ is in good order, and there hasn't been any vandalism. In the last five years there have been 3 funerals, 2 marriages and 4 baptisms.
{ The Parish Room}was first opened in 1894. It is well used by the W.I., the Youth Club, the Parish Council, and other local groups. It is in good condition. Mrs E. A. Lamb cleans the parish room and the church.
